Class nsi.registry.client.java.rrp.api.SecureSocket 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----nsi.registry.client.java.rrp.api.SecureSocketBase
           |
           +----nsi.registry.client.java.rrp.api.SecureSocket
public class SecureSocket
extends SecureSocketBase
SecureSocket provides a common interface to a socket implementation. This object can be implemented using any socket package as long as the public method signatures defined in SecureSocketBase are implemented. By default this object is implemented using the java.net package.

See Also:
SecureSocketBase

SecureSocket(String, int)
Creates a stream socket and connects it to the specified port number on the named host.

close()
Closes this socket.
getInetAddress()
Returns the address to which the socket is connected
getInputStream()
Returns an input stream for this socket.
getOutputStream()
Returns an output stream for this socket.
setSoTimeout(int)
Enable/disable SO_TIMEOUT with the specified timeout, in milliseconds.

SecureSocket 
 public SecureSocket(String host,
                     int port) throws UnknownHostException, IOException
Creates a stream socket and connects it to the specified port number on the named host.

Parameters:
host - the host name.
port - the port number.
Throws: IOException
if an I/O error occurs when creating the socket.
Throws: UnknownHostException
if the IP address of a host could not be determined.

if an I/O error occurs when creating the input stream.

Overrides:

setSoTimeout 
 public void setSoTimeout(int timeout) throws SocketException
Enable/disable SO_TIMEOUT with the specified timeout, in milliseconds. With this option set to a non-zero timeout, a read() call on the InputStream associated with this Socket will block for only this amount of time. If the timeout expires, a java.io.InterruptedIOException is raised, though the Socket is still valid. The option must be enabled prior to entering the blocking operation to have effect. The timeout must be > 0. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

Overrides:
setSoTimeout in class SecureSocketBase
close 
 public void close() throws IOException
Closes this socket.

Throws: IOException
if an I/O error occurs when closing this socket.
Overrides:
close in class SecureSocketBase
